sense.name: reflect brightly
sense.examples: Unquarried marble sparkled on the hillside. The candlelight sparkled in the crystal. Moonlight sparkled on the water. Laughter sparkled in her eyes. Sunlight was sparkling in the waves.

sense.name: be lively or brilliant
sense.examples: The musical performance sparkled. His playing sparkled throughout the concert hall. Her conversation sparkled all evening.

sense.name: emit or produce sparks
sense.examples: A high tension wire, brought down by a storm, continued to sparkle. The flames lept and sparkled. The lighter sparkled and spat, but would not light.

sense.name: become bubbly or frothy
sense.examples: The soda sparkled as its carbonation dissipated. Champagne sparkled in delicate glass flutes. Soup sparkled on the fire.
